page.title: 18ST PETER'S LODSWORTH
page.content: We entered the old{churchyard}by the {Lych Gate}and the Vicar welcomed us at the{Tower Door}and showed us the{Holy {Water Stoop}in the wall.We stood in the{14th century bell tower}and looked up at the ropes. All was safe;the bells were down but we didn't touch the ropes.The oldest bells were cast in 1602,1606,1648 and re-hung with the Tenor bell in 1890.The two lightest were added in 1966.We walked into the {Nave}and looked at the roof beams.The Vicar showed us the{Chancel,}the place for singing. Tower,nave and chancel form the ancient{St Peter's {Chapel, }served by priests from the {Augustinian Priory}at{Easebourne. Up the lane to the north is{St Peter's {Well.}People with eye troubles washed themselves here, hoping to be healed. This well pre-dates the chapel and was a place of pilgrimage for centuries.
